title: @Riot: Early conclusions on Ryze balance?
body: I'd like to hear from  ChampUp or balance: what are the early opinions on Ryze balance? His winrate is atrociously bad, but obviously at least part of that is due to players trying to figure out how to play/build him. Thoughts? And, if you were going to make balance changes, what parts of his kit would you look at?

replies.body: Win rate's low, performance when played well's not bad though and he's got a fair bit of learning curve, especially with the ult. We're going to let him sit as is for a patch, then consider changes for 6.16. If we were to buff him current thinking is that just some base stats might be the most likely thing. He's got plenty of damage already and at least right now we don't want to put more power into his ult either.
I don't play Ryze, but I hope you're taking into consideration the camera complaints people are throwing out.

This!!!! 100 times this!!!! Please, for the love of god, fix the camera whiplash. Me and several other players have made posts about this to no official response from anyone at riot. The ult camera whiplash needs to be fixed. Having to refocus the camera by spamming spacebar among other things should not be an additional requirement of using his ult.
Have you experienced them by chance? Makes me dizzy every time I press R. :(
I have not. But any issue with UI is the worst kind of issue.

Cheers, would you also consider scaling his w?

I mean that currently there is no incentive to level W. I propose that we nerf his W root duration early level, and make it scale per rank (maybe .25 or .5 seconds per lvl). I'm not sure how it will scale with his e. 

This way if ryze wants to be more utility focused he can choose to level w. Right now there is no reason to get more than 1 point in w, this will offer more strategic and playstyle options for ryze players. 

I think there should NEVER be a skill which should stay at rank 1. Maxing any basic ability should be a real and valid choice (ie IRELIA you can max qwe for different reasons, none are wrong). By giving better utility incentive to level w, you could also encourage other builds like max w ryze support etc. 

In a similar way that I believe that ranking abilities should offer more than just damage, ie maybe wukong's clone lasts longer so clone max wukong can be a viable build. I really hate seeing the one PERFECT, META build, and I think you should allow us the option of being able to max ANY skill, with different strengths and weaknesses. 
**(what do you think? --- do you believe that maxing sol's e should be a viable playstyle? or it should be actively discouraged) **

Levelling w would make ryze players choose to give up strength for utility, and I think players should have a choice on HOW they wanna build ryze and decide for ourselves what parts of his kit we like and which one we should max. 

Thanks have a great day

Having a clear ability to max last isn't necessarily a bad thing. It allows for his snares power to remain consistent throughout the entire game. Since hes a damaged based champion keeping his snare duration the same is a good thing since it allows him to scale his primary asset (damage) rather than having to invest in his minimal utility. With a utility champion like {{champion:40}} you max her shield first because it's her primary asset. 

Maxing Sol's e would just be strange. His e was designed around being the last ability you max. The benefits of the ability don't scale well enough to worth maxing. Asking to have every max order to be viable is asking to restructure the entire balance of the game. How do you make it viable to max Lucain W first? Or ashe E? Or Bard W? 

Players have a choice as to how they want to build Ryze, but there is always going to be an optimal way. If you want to focus on utility then use your runic charges to get the 2 second snare rather than optimizing damage. 

I don't disagree with you that having the freedom to ability max how you want would be cool but making that happen would be impossible from a balance standpoint.

Thanks for the reply, I agree with what you're saying. I think, though, if skillsets are designed to have equal skills (ie the basic skills are all good in some sitatution over the other, rather than this one basic ability is FAR stronger and MUST be maxed), it promotes more strategic options for the players.

Overall I totally understand what you're saying man, but I think it might be cool to allow people to experiment with different maxing orders.

Janna (unless you are trolling and playing her full ap or playing her in ARAM) always maxes e. Ask any high level support player. He is is really really good and you only need 1 point in q. and w is just ok. She can max in any order she wants but if you aren't maxing E first you are playing her wrong.

E lv 1 on Ash (i can't spell get over it XD) is fine. But you only put 1 point in it until all other abilities are maxed. Or you are missing out an a bunch of damage. 

You never max w on bard. its his worst ability by a lot. Hes a high pressure high damage support and you want to take advantage of that by being able to use q as much as possible. There are reasons these things are "set". Because it's what utilizes the full strength of the champion.

Fair counterpoints , i Still think SOLO Lane janna's should be maxing Q. 

aaargh i forget ash e got changed! Damn I was referring to the ability which gave gold. I legit maxed that first ^^. 

YOu make a good point about bard. Riot is forcing people to play him a certain way. But in my opinion, If i wanna play BARD passively and just focusing on healing a lot , it should be a viable option for me to play Bard that way. 

Right now its NOT viable and you're arguing its because bard SHOULD be played aggressively. While that is certainly A play-style, dont you think we should encourage alternative play-styles as well, ie both q max and w max bards are both equally viable builds (not neccessarily both are equally strong, but maxing w MAY be a viable choice in SOME situations) 

I'm not saying maxing q is wrong. I'm saying that in some situations/games I want better HP packs. I am choosing to sacrifice power from my q into making me a better healer. I'm saying that this should be allowed and encouraged, personalizing and leveling skills in any order you want.

I mean some champions are versatile in what they do, but that's not an innate part of being a champion - in fact, most versatile champions pay for being so versatile by being overall weaker than the more focused competition. Bard's W isn't really a "heal," it's just a way for him to aid a teammate when he's not around. Provide them some extra sustain, effectively being some regen that can be tapped into at a later time. This is because you've just flat-out picked the wrong champion if you want someone who can play passively; every part of his kit is designed around either being more powerful when you roam, or enabling roaming flat-out.

Making him able to opt into just being someone who picks his nose / mouth hole and acts as a healbot would require weakening his ability to roam aggressively ( so he can't do both and be dominant ) which in turn just leads to him losing what makes him unique. Which is rather silly, as if you just want to play a passive healbot, again, you just can play Soraka.

The primary way you determine your playstyle for a match comes in champion select. You can alter the details of exactly how you're playing through items, skill builds, and ( although this is technically champion select too ) runes, masteries, and summoner spells, but the way you define the core of what you'll being doing and how you'll do it is through picking the champion best suited for what you want to do. If that wasn't the case, there might as well not be any champions at; League might as well give you a generic template character and let you define what you'll be doing through picking abilities or having a large collection of active item that make up for the base abilities being very generic and broad.

Meddler I just have a quick question about Ryze ult (not really about balance specifically). Can you fire a projectile into the ult to take it somewhere else (Like an Ashe or Ezreal ult for instance)?

The ult only shifts units, so it won't move things like Ashe ult or Ezreal ult. It also won't shift untargetable champion created minions like Maokai Saplings. It will move champion created stuff with a health bar though like Shaco Jack in the Boxes, Tibbers etc. 

An ability that allows you to shift missiles to another spot's certainly got some potential, would want to do it as the focus of a spell though, not a side (and therefore often accidental) thing.

How about this, Riot. How to make Ryze good again?

1) Remove the damn clear wave. It's insane how he can just clear the wave at level 2. "Oh, my enemy is pushing the lane? I can do better!"
2) His passive is pretty shit. Now you make him an AP champion over Mana when Ryze's whole kit is based on Mana, not AP.
3) How long is his Ryze's Rune Prison (W) again? 15-17 seconds long? Oh right. You must W the correct champion to make Rye strong.
4) Don't even think I would say this Ryze good.
5) The moment you took out his E penetration and Spellvamp Ryze winrate became worse.
6) If I was you, I fire the person who thought this Ryze would be good.
7) If you were to keep one Ryze you, Riot, should've kept the second version Ryze. Reasoning? Wasn't as broken as the first version becasue it had decent early-game trades. If you were to remove the level 3 clear wave on the second version, I think that Ryze would've been fine. If you were to buff second version Ryze's W range and E damage, I think that Ryze would've been right.
8) Ryze is suppose to have a bad early game, but an amazing late game. You didn't give him that anymore. Now you gave him an early game clear wave and trades. This Ryze I only see a mid-game while the others were late game.
9) The currecnt Ryze has the damage, but you gotta buff up his Rune Prison.
10) His ultimate (R) is so easily detachable. Who's idea was it? Fire him.

Final Thoughts? This is not Ryze.

Firstly, "Fire the person who thought this Ryze would be good" is a bit of an over statement. Plus this line is used so much, no one really cares about it at this point. It just makes you come off as a loud idiot, no offense.
Secondly, yes, they seem to have shifted his power balance a bit. It's a rework. It's not the Ryze we knew, but it's just that. A rework.
Thirdly, why complain? Riot gives no cares.

Sorry. I'm mad as hell right now. This Ryze just pisses me off every time I see him being played. Every time someone mention about the new Ryze I just mute them in chat. A rework? I don't mind, but this Ryze has to go. Riot will not understand the player base if we don't say something. Of course, Riot doesn't give a fuck. But us players do.

Why does it piss you off? Wave clear isn't inherently a bad thing. For me, what irks me is the lack of creative and unique content to it. And you are right. I miss the older MR shred, it meant Ryze had better choices to itemize as a more brawling mage type that ISN'T a pain in the ass like Gragas. I do miss Spell Vamp, but Riot's going through it's Edgy Phase so... just give them time. I do think that this new Ryze is just a rehashed Medivh from the Warcraft Universe. I think that Riot had a chance to create something unique and instead dropped the ball with his ultimate. I am sure even you could admit that if they moved his Pen to his old ult and kept that, it would have been a more acceptable rework. But, alas, Riot went to see the Warcraft movie and climaxed themselves at the idea of ripping off a rather neat concept of an ability.

In short, my issue with his rework is mostly his ultimate.

It is a cool skill, and honestly, I DO want to see it in LoL.

But NOT on a champion that has been marketed from the beginning as a beginner friendly champion. Not on a champion whose kit does not reflect the use of such utility. Not on an champion that it does not FEEL right on.

Hell, if they threw that ult on Bard instead of his Zhonya's ult, you must admit it would feel far more satisfying than on the champion they gave it.

I know why you're angry. I know where you're coming from. But getting mad and ranting won't help. Who knows, you may be right though. Maybe Riot CAN be convinced that they made a mistake. But you and I both know they won't.
